items.title: Federal housing agency will not cut Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac loan limits, new director says
items.content: The new director of the FHFA said he has no intention of shrinking the limit on loans bought and guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
items.contentSnippet: The new director of the FHFA said he has no intention of shrinking the limit on loans bought and guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

items.title: Chinese bubble tea chain Chagee files for U.S. initial public offering
items.content: Chagee is planning to open its first U.S. store this spring in Los Angeles.
items.contentSnippet: Chagee is planning to open its first U.S. store this spring in Los Angeles.

items.title: Affirm announces JPMorgan Chase merchants can soon offer installment loans at checkout
items.content: U.S. merchants who use JPMorgan to handle payments can soon add Affirm to their checkout pages, according to a release.
items.contentSnippet: U.S. merchants who use JPMorgan to handle payments can soon add Affirm to their checkout pages, according to a release.

items.title: How the rich use insurance to invest in private credit without steep tax bills
items.content: Private credit is a hot asset class but comes with hefty income taxes. Top earners can save on tax with specific insurance policies known as PPVA and PPLI.
items.contentSnippet: Private credit is a hot asset class but comes with hefty income taxes. Top earners can save on tax with specific insurance policies known as PPVA and PPLI.

items.title: Eli Lilly will soon release key data on its weight loss pill. Here's why it could be a game-changer
items.content: The trial results are critical, as it brings Eli Lilly's pill one step closer to becoming a new, needle-free alternative for weight loss and diabetes.
items.contentSnippet: The trial results are critical, as it brings Eli Lilly's pill one step closer to becoming a new, needle-free alternative for weight loss and diabetes.

items.title: South Korea's Hyundai announces $21 billion U.S. investment
items.content: Hyundai is the latest major international conglomerate to announce investments ahead of Trump's April 2 tariff deadline.

items.title: Why it suddenly feels like every fast-food restaurant has fun, flavored drinks
items.content: Wendy's, Taco Bell and Chick-fil-A are among the restaurant chains that are looking beyond fountain soda for their drink offerings.

items.title: Take a look inside French luxury retailer Printemps' first U.S. store
items.content: Printemps opened a 55,000-square-foot store in New York City with luxury brands and food concepts, including a restaurant and a café with French pastries.
items.contentSnippet: Printemps opened a 55,000-square-foot store in New York City with luxury brands and food concepts, including a restaurant and a café with French pastries.

items.title: Zepbound copycats remain online despite FDA ban
items.content: Copycat versions of Eli Lilly's diabetes drug Mounjaro and obesity drug Zepbound were supposed to go away this week. They're still available on some websites.
items.contentSnippet: Copycat versions of Eli Lilly's diabetes drug Mounjaro and obesity drug Zepbound were supposed to go away this week. They're still available on some websites.

items.title: London’s Heathrow Airport resumes flights after major fire nearby shuts down travel
items.content: London's Heathrow Airport closed on Friday after a fire at a nearby electrical substation caused a power outage, airport officials said.
items.contentSnippet: London's Heathrow Airport closed on Friday after a fire at a nearby electrical substation caused a power outage, airport officials said.

items.title: Boston Celtics sold for $6.1 billion to group led by private equity executive Bill Chisholm

items.contentSnippet: A group led by private equity executive Bill Chisholm is buying the NBA's Boston Celtics for $6.1 billion.

items.title: February home resales jump much more than expected, despite higher mortgage rates
items.content: The median price of a home sold in February was $398,400, up 3.8% from the same time last year.
items.contentSnippet: The median price of a home sold in February was $398,400, up 3.8% from the same time last year.

items.title: Darden Restaurants sales disappoint, but Olive Garden parent sees consumers continuing to spend

items.title: Auto suppliers face more dire circumstances than automakers amid Trump tariffs

items.title: Boeing shares jump after CFO gives upbeat outlook, says cash burn is easing
items.content: Boeing's cash burn is easing this quarter and its factories are improving, the aerospace giant's CFO Brian West's said.

items.title: Cadillac expects one of every three vehicle sales to be EVs in 2025
items.content: Cadillac expects up to 35% of its U.S. sales this year to be EVs, as it continues to expand its lineup despite industrywide slower-than-expected adoption.
items.contentSnippet: Cadillac expects up to 35% of its U.S. sales this year to be EVs, as it continues to expand its lineup despite industrywide slower-than-expected adoption.

items.title: Watch NASA astronauts return to Earth on SpaceX capsule after months on the ISS
items.content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams are set to splash down on Earth on Tuesday evening after spending more than nine months in space.
items.contentSnippet: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams are set to splash down on Earth on Tuesday evening after spending more than nine months in space.

items.title: Boeing Starliner astronauts complete return to Earth in SpaceX capsule after extended stay on ISS

items.title: Forever 21 expected to close all U.S. stores, blames Shein and Temu for demise
items.content: Forever 21 blamed its second bankruptcy on rising competition from upstarts like Shein and Temu and their use of the de minimis exemption, a trade law loophole.
items.contentSnippet: Forever 21 blamed its second bankruptcy on rising competition from upstarts like Shein and Temu and their use of the de minimis exemption, a trade law loophole.

items.title: PepsiCo buys prebiotic soda brand Poppi for nearly $2 billion
